contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Naka (disambiguation)}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Naka District in Ibaraki Prefecture.svg|thumb|Location of Naka District in [[Ibaraki Prefecture]]]] {{nihongo|'''Naka'''|那珂郡|Naka-gun}} is a [[districts of Japan|district]] of [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]], [[Japan]]. Following the January 21, 2005 formation of the city of [[Naka, Ibaraki|Naka]], the district is coextensive with the village of [[Tōkai, Ibaraki|Tōkai]]. As of January 1, 2005 population data, the district has an estimated [[population]] of 35,467 and a [[population density|density]] of 946.29 persons per km². The total area is 37.48 km². ==Towns and villages== *[[Tōkai, Ibaraki|Tōkai]] ==Timeline (Heisei Era)== *On October 16, 2004 the town of [[Ōmiya, Ibaraki|Ōmiya]] absorbed the villages of [[Miwa, Ibaraki|Miwa]] and [[Ogawa, Ibaraki (Naka)|Ogawa]], all from Naka District, the town of [[Yamagata, Ibaraki|Yamagata]], and the village of [[Gozenyama, Ibaraki|Gozenyama]], both from [[Higashiibaraki District, Ibaraki|Higashiibaraki District]], to become the new city of [[Hitachiōmiya, Ibaraki|Hitachiōmiya]]. *On January 21, 2005 the town of Naka absorbed the town of [[Urizura, Ibaraki|Urizura]] to become the new city of [[Naka, Ibaraki|Naka]]. {{Ibaraki}} {{coord|36|27|38|N|140|35|17|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts in Ibaraki Prefecture]] {{Ibaraki-geo-stub}}
